column4: If you are trying to run a remote gui app over ssh, you have to include the, "-X" otherwise X11 forwarding will not be enabled.
yes, but I want it to show on the remote box, not mine,
I can get it to run on my box
Ah, I see.  I think you can specify the display variable (ex. 0:0) or whatever to have it launch and run remotely.
Let me see if in can figure it out...
yes, I was thinking there was a way to do that, export!  thanks
I'm sure of it.  I just have to remember how...
I think I got it here:  http://www.cisl.ucar.edu/docs/ssh/guide/node29.html
initial test failed, I must need to export the display in the same command as I want exported.
I lost my shell session (poor connectivity to the wireless network) so I just got back here now.  In playing, I found that if you set the DISPLAY variable to, ":0.0" it will work.
without messing with the xauthority it will work?
Yes.  That's the beauty of doing X over ssh!
that will be easier to remember too, thanks a bundle!
You still have to ssh to the remote host with the, "-X" option.  But once you do that, simply do, "export DISPLAY=":0.0" and your set!
yes, I love ssh, I can organize pics, sync my wife's pc with mine, and put a message on the kids laptop. lol :)
